title: 104_hr3115
content: The "Alcohol Ingredient Labeling Act of 1996" may be cited as the Act. It pertains to labeling requirements for alcohol products. Section 403 of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act is amended to require labeling for alcoholic beverages containing more than 0.5% alcohol by volume. The label must disclose the alcohol content, number of drinks, ingredients, calories per container and per drink, and the common or usual name of each ingredient. It must also include a statement regarding alcohol consumption. The labeling requirement for alcoholic beverages with more than 0.5% alcohol by volume includes disclosing alcohol content, number of drinks, ingredients, calories, and a statement about alcohol consumption. Additionally, the label must bear a statement providing a toll-free number for help with drinking problems. The terms 'malt beverage' and 'wine' are defined in the context of the law. The term 'distilled spirit' includes various types of alcoholic beverages with alcohol content between 7% and 24% for nonindustrial use, excluding mixtures with more than 50% wine. The Secretary will regulate the information required on malt beverage, wine, or distilled spirit labels to ensure it is prominently displayed, easily readable, and offset by borders. The term 'drink' refers to a serving containing .6 ounces of alcohol by volume, while 'ingredient' excludes trace ingredients. The Secretary will regulate the information required on malt beverage, wine, or distilled spirit labels to ensure it is prominently displayed, easily readable, and offset by borders. The labeling requirements include stating the number of drinks in a container, represented by a beer mug symbol on the front. Authorization is granted for $500,000 annually to establish and operate a toll-free number. The Commissioner of the FDA must submit a report within 90 days on the effectiveness of the Surgeon General's warning format in combination with new ingredient information on beverage labels. Recommendations for improvement should be included.
